column4: I'm having huge memory issues with ubuntu. It keeps just slowing down to a halt, then I can't even move the mouse cursor, the screen freezes up and I have to press the computer's power button to switch it off. I never had this problem with previous ubuntu versions. Is there any way of fixing this or will I just have to switch back to Windows?
I seem to have the same problem but I'm runing Ubuntu in vitualbox, I'm not sure if it is virtualbox's problem or ubuntu's
ubuntu 9.04 seems to be plagued with problems, it's a disappointing release
really? oh that is so disapointing...i am running the nettop remix on my msi and seem to have no problem at all, but on the virtual machine it just dies...kubuntu 9.04 didnt have this problem on me
